title: Facies
summary: In geology, a facies (/ˈfeɪʃiːz/ FAY-sheez; plural also facies)[lower-alpha 1] is a body of rock with specified characteristics,[1] which can be any observable attribute of rocks (such as their overall appearance, composition, or condition of formation), and the changes that may occur in those attributes over a geographic area. It is the sum total characteristics of a rock including its chemical, physical, and biological features that distinguishes it from adjacent rock.[2]
